content.question: Which of the following expressions is equal to <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the complex fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus the fraction 1 over n, end complex fraction, plus the complex fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus the fraction 2 over n, end complex fraction, plus the complex fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus the fraction 3 over n, end complex fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus the complex fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus the fraction n over n, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo symmetric="false">(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac><mo symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 2, of, the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 1, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 3, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 1, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 plus x, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
